title: Press, rights groups condemn killing of Mexican reporter
title_page: Press, rights groups condemn killing of Mexican reporter | Daily Mail Online
text:
Press, rights groups condemn killing of Mexican reporter
MEXICO CITY (AP) — International press and human rights groups are condemning the killing of a journalist in the southern Mexico state of Oaxaca.
The Inter-American Commission on Human Rights is calling on Mexican authorities to investigate whether Marcos Hermandez Bautista was killed because of his work.
The Inter-American Press Association says he was found dead of a gunshot wound to the head in his car on Jan. 21.
Hernandez Bautista worked as a reporter for the Oaxaca newspaper Noticias, Voz e Imagen and as a radio reporter and a cultural official for a local city government.
The IACHR said Hernandez Bautista had told his newspaper he feared reprisals for his work.
